thread.title_full: Garden Fresh Vegetarian Food - Hacienda Heights California Vegan Restaurant - HappyCow

posts.title: Garden Fresh Vegetarian Food - Hacienda Heights California Vegan Restaurant - HappyCow
posts.text: Excellent food - Edit Posted by akanne on 21 Oct 2013. I've been a regular customer for years now. I usually go during lunch time on Fridays and Saturdays but I also go at other times. Lunch gets really crowded around noon and some people place orders over the phone and they tend to those orders first. The con about the lunch special is that sometimes they run out of food, which tells you that it's good food too. The whole family is Vegetarian, except for the cook's sister, who is now working as the server. As per the reviewer who talked about the snobbish daughter, I've had that experience as well. Both daughters are a little snobbish but the parents compensate by being extra friendly. The daughters are rarely there, so, please don't let that experience deter you from coming back. I would recommend the fried oyster mushrooms with basil, Dumpling noodle soup, Soy fish in any of the many sauces, KungPao Tofu or soy chicken. In the afternoon, the ladies leave and the cook is left alone tending the restaurant, he does not speak much English, so I would recommend you to take the menu and tell him the numbers. The menu is in English and Chinese. Be patient with him as he'll be alone and cooks the food as you order it. No reheating or microwave in that kitchen so you'll hear him chopping and frying and rattling pans as you wait. In the evenings, the wife or the sister come back to help with dinner, so you don't have to wait that long. Highly recommended vegan restaurant. Updated from previous review on Monday October 21, 2013 Updated from previous review on Monday October 21, 2013

posts.title: Sluggo's North Vegetarian Cafe - Chattanooga Tennessee Vegan Restaurant - HappyCow
posts.text:
Would drive two hours for lunch - Edit Posted by Raesock on 24 Jun 2016. My husband and I LOVE Sluggo's! We've driven down from Nashville just for lunch! I always get the Culture Club with a side of beans and a salad with their tahini dressing. I've tried to recreate it at home but it is never just right. The sandwich is delicious too. Before going vegan a club was one of my go too menu items, so it is fun to have a place to get a good, compassionate one. My only complaint is that the guy taking our order (it has always been the same one) seems annoyed that we are in the restaurant. I promise we are not demanding or rude, and we've never been there when it is busy. It is kind of a turn off, but once those plates hit the table, all is forgiven. I wish they would open a Nashville location! Update: I have moved on from the culture club and now love the lentil melt. The texture is so good and I love the mushrooms on it. The store has moved locations and is very nice now! Also, the rude guy from before has gotten much nicer. Sluggo's rules. 
Pros: great food, tahini dressing

thread.title: The Grain Shop - West London Vegetarian Restaurant - HappyCow
thread.title_full: The Grain Shop - West London Vegetarian Restaurant - HappyCow

posts.title: The Grain Shop - West London Vegetarian Restaurant - HappyCow
posts.text:
Posted by The Wandering Vegan on 22 Aug 2009. They have a great selection of vegan and vegetarian foods. It's inconvenient that it is take-away only, yet, if you ask for your container with no lid you will get twice as much food so it's worth the hassle. There is a park nearby to sit in to eat. It's a good deal for the price which was around 5 pounds. I would actually give the food quality 5 stars. The split pea dal with rice and greens is delicious. There is a great variety to choose from for both vegans and vegetarians; however, the vegan food is not marked. I'm allergic to egg and dairy so I hate to have to ask about every item. They do have yummy vegan and gluten-free desserts which are marked. Overall a great little vegetarian eatery on Portobello Road. 
Pros: Delicious food, Inexpensive (by London standards anyway), Generous portions if you get no lid 
Cons: Take-away only, Vegan items not marked as "vegan"

organizations.name: grain shop - west london vegetarian restaurant

By submitting this post you agree to HappyCow Terms Post Your Response Best Vegan Food in Town - Edit Posted by BryanGuiot on 04 Oct 2014. Totally fresh ingredients. Excellent flavors. Very friendly service. Dine in or take out. Check it out. You will not be disappointed. Updated from previous review on Friday October 04, 2013 
Pros: Quality of ingredients, Excellent flavors, Very friendly service By submitting this post you agree to HappyCow Terms Post Your Response Lovely Cafe, Delicious Food - Edit Posted by AvocadoLover on 26 Jul 2014. This is a great little cafe located in the library/computer area of The Center (LGBT Center) and may be a little bit difficult to locate if your going for the first time. The atmosphere is really nice and relaxed. Comfortable place to hang out, read, converse, etc. Staff are always super nice and great to talk with. The food is ridiculously good. Seriously! Fresh, clean nutrition straight up. Love the salads, Tree of Life, vegan cheesecake, smoothies... Basically everything vegan on their menu if fantastic. Definitely a worth while place to grab breakfast or lunch to stay or to go! 
Pros: Real Delicious Nutrition, Great Atmosphere, Friendly Staff By submitting this post you agree to HappyCow Terms Post Your Response Very pleasant experience - Edit Posted by sglcklch on 06 Mar 2014. I was staying downtown and this place was pretty close by so I decided to check it out. Being able to walk here from my hotel was a big plus. It didn't take long, but it was located in a residential community and very much off the beaten path. The neighborhood seemed a little shady as well. For that reason this cafe - being in the LGBTQ center no less - felt like an oasis. The space was roomy, bright, and clean. Vegan options were plentiful and clearly marked. Almost all the baked goods were vegan, and they even had raw vegan cheesecakes. I had the "bizness" special where I got to pick three side salads served on a bed of kale. I ordered the carrot and lentil, beet and quinoa, and the red pepper hummus, which also happened to come with a piece of warm pita! I liked how everything tasted so light and fresh, but being the spice lover that I am, I did find the food a tad bit flat and thought it could use more flavors. Nonetheless it was a healthy and enjoyable meal. The real star of the show, though, was the raw chocolate "cheesecake". I have had countless raw cakes that were too soft like a mousse and/or too agave-happy. This one was quite spot-on both in terms of texture and taste. I also bought a couple of baked goods to go for later. Those were delicious too. The staff members were the nicest people. They were knowledgeable and very happy to answer my questions regarding the ingredients. I just wish they were more eco-friendly. I ate in and was still given paper/plastic containers and utensils. 
Pros: healthy vegan food, friendly & knowledgeable staff 
Cons: surroundings, too much waste

thread.title_full: Frankie's East Side Pizza - Farmingdale New York Veg-options Restaurant - HappyCow

posts.title: Frankie's East Side Pizza - Farmingdale New York Veg-options Restaurant - HappyCow
posts.text:
Incredible Vegan Menu @ Frankie's - Edit Posted by PDA4Animals on 01 Nov 2017. Absolutely incredible vegan food from appetizers to main meals to desserts!!! Danny, the owner, is doing everything right here! He is so amazing for taking the steps to make our (vegan) lives easier, offering great tasting cruelty free options on a very long island with not many vegan places for us to conveniently enjoy! He is so personable and definitely makes you feel at home once you walk through the doors! And, very importantly, he sees how expensive it is for vegans to indulge and offers very generous weekly discounts to us for choosing to be cruelty free!!! My boyfriend and I went there today for the first time and ordered the vegan drumsticks, drunken grandma slice, whole large vegan pizza, vegetable ravioli, pineapple cake, banana cake, carrot cake, and zucchini cake. Yes all this just for the of us and totally worth it. Everything is homemade and so tasty, just so super satisfying. They impressed us one item after another. We couldn't even decide what was better than the other. Everything was incredible. We very highly recommend Frankie's East Side Pizza on Main Street in Farmingdale, you will be very satisfied with anything that you order. ENJOY!!! 
Pros: Excelent food, Very fair pricing, Very friendly 
Cons: N/A just began offering vegan, menu will be growin, N/A new vegan menu will be printed soon, N/A not fully vegan, but has great vegan options!

organizations.name: east side pizza - farmingdale new york veg-options restaurant
